resource.chars:
** Add in the middle of the opposite page.
If this line were continued westward from Tyndrum
it would pass near Inverary, but some eruptive
masses of Porphyry on the west side of Loch Fyne
have destroyed the regularity of the foliation in
that neighbourhood; the vertical line however reappears farther west & crosses Knapdale where
it attracted Macculloch’s attention: the same
author also describes the foliation of the Schists
meeting in a rooflike form down the middle of
Cantyre. Thus he has pointed out both the central
axis of the arch just described, as well as its
northern border, without observing the arched
arrangement of the <s>district<\s> foliation. (Western Isles
vol. 2 p. 287).
